column2: KANSAS DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column6: KS

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: be aware possible hazards ahead.

column2: 2. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
column6: Drivers who are fatigued.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column8: Do not enter

column2: 4. To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
column4: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.
column6: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.
column8: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.

column2: 5. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: Wrong Way
column8: Merging Traffic

column2: 7. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column4: is a good defensive driving technique.
column6: can block traffic.
column8: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

column2: 8. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column6: look for a human flagger.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 9. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
column6: Do not pass
column8: Pass with caution

column2: 10. When there is a potential for animals standing on the roadway, you should:
column4: honk your horn to scare the animals away.
column6: slow down and use flashers or a headlight signal to scare the animals away.
column8: slow down and proceed with caution.

column2: 11. You are driving at night, and a vehicle comes toward you with their high beam headlights on. You should:
column6: flash your headlights once quickly.
column8: look in the direction of the vehicle.

column2: 12. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column6: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.

column2: 13. What does BAC stand for?
column6: Blood Alcohol Commission
column8: Blood Alcohol Concentration

column2: 14. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column6: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 15. Your BAC depends on:
column6: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column8: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 16. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 17. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column6: The last driver to reach the intersection.
column8: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.

column2: 18. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column6: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 19. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column6: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 20. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column6: red, yellow and green
column8: green, yellow and red

column2: 21. To avoid panic stops, you should:
column4: scan the road ahead for hazards.
column6: pump your brakes to make sure they work.
column8: drive with your window down.

column2: 22. When passing another vehicle, you should:
column4: check your mirrors and blind spots.
column6: assume the other vehicle will maintain a constant speed.
column8: drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.

column2: 23. Green and white signs:
column4: give information about directions and distances.
column6: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column8: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: Truck must back up
column8: Steep downgrade ahead

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column6: Crossroads ahead
column8: No U-Turn
